name: spryly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone, especially an older person, moves spryly, they move quickly and energetically: Despite the heat, some people in their 90s ambled around as spryly as kids. He arrived at her side just as she had spryly stepped up onto the kerb.
More examplesFewer examplesHe hops spryly into a blue pickup truck with a cracked windscreen.In my clinic, I see some 90-year-olds who jump spryly on and off the examining table like 40-year-olds.The demonstrators - students, labourers, grandmothers - spryly danced around a large bonfire.
